Math manipulations in Phyco¶

As a physics engine, phyco provides considerable math processing ability.

There are paragraphs marked in “For Developers” in bold face, which are functions you’re not required to know how to work with it. You’re mostly likely benefits from just how to define it.

Generic Math Processing¶

Classes in this section will be implemented or is in development in C++.

class phycomath.genmath.expr(str, params=None)¶
predeffunc={'sin', 'cos', 'tan', 'csc', 'sec', 'cot',
'sinh', 'cosh', 'tanh', 'ln', 'sqrt'}

A unique structure for math expression. Supports elementary arithmetic operations and elementary functions as listed above. It will finally break your expression in string to sequence.

Define an expression with params treated as parameters. There’s no need to declare symbolic variable in Phyco, since all letters in the expression are regarded as symbol except for those in predeffunc.

Tip

Only \(ln()\) is supported in series of logarithms, but you can use change of base rule to obtain any.

For Developers:

__call__()¶

Call the expression just by exprname(valuedict) to get result of it evaluated at valuedict.

latex()¶

Return LaTex format expression.

class phycomath.genmath.eqn(str, params=None)¶

Type designed for equation.

For Developers:

equal() → bool¶

Return if the equation is true.

solve(paramvalues : dict, initvalue)¶

Return a numeric solution (if any) by newton’s method.

Linear Algebra & related¶

class phycomath.linalg.vector(a=0, b=0, c=0, mode='rec')¶

Note

Currently spherical coordinate system isn’t available, and won’t be available in next few weeks.

Define a vector with first, second, third parameter as a, b, c in cartesian (rec), cylinder (cyl) or spherical (sph) coordinate system, as in mode.

For Developers:

Use *, +, - to obtain a scalar product, sum and difference, respectively.

dot(other : vector) → scalar¶

Return inner product of two vectors.

cross(other : vector) → vector¶

Return self cross other.

trans(coord='cyl') → vector¶

Caution

To be deprecated

Transform the vector to another coordinate system.

angle(other : vector) → angle¶

Return the angle between self and other.

unitize() → vector¶

Return unit vector with same direction of self.

isCollinear(other : vector) → int¶

Return if two vector are collinear. It has four possible returns.

Return table:

exactly same direction True
opposing direction -1
zero-vector collinear 2
None of above False
class phycomath.linalg.field(x, y, z='', *paramlist)¶

Creates a field with x, y, z specified by user. You can also include parameter in your definition.

For Developers:

class phycomath.linalg.matrix(data, immutable=False)¶
